section.title: Exercise: Convert a Java project to Groovy
Create a Java project script
section.para: Use the Eclipse wizard to create a new Java project called com.vogella.groovy.fromjava and create a package called fromjava .

section.title: Create a Java class
section.para: Create a Java bean in this project called Task with two properties.
Use the code generation capacities of the Eclipse IDE to generate getter and setter, the constructor, the toString and equals and hashcode method.

section.title: Main method
section.para: Create a new class with a main method In this method construct at least one instance of Task .

section.title: Convert to Groovy
section.para:
Right-click on your project and select
Configure Convert to Groovy Project
. This adds the Groovy libraries to the project classpath and adds the Groovy builder.

Right-click on your Task class and select
Convert Convert file extension to Groovy
.

section.title: Simplify the Task class
section.para: Simplify the Task class and ensure that the Java main program still can use it.
Congratulation! You converted your first object to Groovy and used it in an Java program.
